data.expected: BT (Blue) x BT (Blue) -> 1/4 BB (Blue), 1/2 BT (Blue), 1/4 TT (Turquoise)
data.sampled: You are suggesting that the genotypes of the parent would be BB (Blue) and BB (Turquoise). However this would result in 2B_ (Turquoise) and 2BB (Two blues and one turquoise) which is not a valid combination. To resolve this, change Blue to BB and surprisingly there will now be two different combinations and the actual number of each can be calculated. In this case, BB x color would result in 2B_ providing 4 valid parents while BB x BB would result in BB+B_ = 2B_ because of dominance which favors one parent.

data.sampled:
Generate a random bag containing 10 Blue 1s and 10 Green 1s. The bag contains bag will HAVE 2 Bass and 1 Baby. The probability of rolling a Bass given a bag containing 10 Blue Bass and 10 Baby Bass, and a rolling a Baby given a bag containing 10 Green 1s?
A Bass is defined as player rolling a number less than 6 scoring a "6" count. Bag containing 10 Green 1s is defined as not rolling a Bass. The probability of rolling a Bass given a bag containing 10 Bass and 2 Baby Bass and 8*1 Green 1s is 1/11. The probability of the bag containing a Fishery given 10+7+3*1 Green 1s is SELF-SIMILAR, so, s=9 (22=4*1), a likelihood factor of 9100=96%, so, the probability of the baby given the Fishery is SELF-SIMILAR, so, p=9 (a a 50% chance
A Fishery is defined as a number between 1-5 and the laid down count is 4-20. The Fishery of a shellfish found when hunting adds a "BB" to the assayed rainbow count.
